course_title: Topics: Environmental Studies: Remote Sensing Environment
class_notes: Pre-requisites: At least one previous quantitative methods/statistics class (required) and Geographic Information Systems (Preferred, but not required)
course_description: Variable topics that are offered as irregular courses. Past course topics have included: Finding Place: Technology, Stories, and the Environment; Introduction to Botany; Environment, Health, and Development; Conservation and Development; Booms and Busts in Resources of Georgia; and Paleoecology.
schedule_location: TTh 8:30am-9:45am in Math & Science Center - W502
sections: Class Nbr: 4885, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: J. Clennon, Status: Open
